hanzi-su-wiki:
軒

Значения

Карниз, край крыши, кровля; высокий; счётный суффикс домов

Мнемоника

Экипаж 車 сановника с закрытой кабиной и передним грязевым щитком 干. Позднее — навес, постройка, дом.

Варианты

轩
purpleculture_pinyin:
xuān
pavilion with a view; high; tall; high fronted, curtained carriage (old)
беседка с видом; высоко; высокий; карета с высоким фасадом, занавешенная (старая)
rtega_mnemonic:
軒軒RS
轩轩		carriage, high, wide, balcony, flats, eaves
  • RS. a cart 車 with a front bar 干: a type of carriage; it is parked in front of the high and wide flat of it's owner and is visible from it's balcony
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 轩)
Pictophonetic: 干 indicates the sound; 車 (cart) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
軒然大波 [ xuān rán dà bō ]: huge waves; (fig.) ruckus; controversy; sensation
軒轅 [ xuān yuán ]: Xuan Yuan, personal name of Huangdi, the Yellow Emperor 黄帝
軒轅 [ xuān yuán ]: two-character surname Xuanyuan
軒昂 [ xuān áng ]: high; lofty; elevated; dignified
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 車 [ chē ] cart, vehicle; to move in a cart
    • 干 [ gàn ] arid, dry; to oppose; to offend; to invade
heisig_chinese_memo: Flats in the city are crowded. You get a space for your car in front, and a clothesline out back.  You're very lucky if you have a veranda.
heisig_story: This kanji, a counter for houses, is made up of cars . . . dry.
koohiiStory1: Flats in the city are crowded. You get a space for your car in front, and a clothesline out back. Nothing else.
koohiiStory2: Small flats (garages) for cars help keeping them dry.
jp_example_words:
軒並み(のきなみ): row of houses
軒(のき): eaves, house
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic:
Your car is dry because you kept it under the eaves of your house.
This kanji has a second meaning too: house counter. Imagine counting all the houses on your block by the number of eaves you see keeping cars dry.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: One eave, one house. Two eaves, two houses.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: On top of the eaves of your house Ken (けん) the samurai is counting houses too.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Ken hops down and explains that he's been hired to count all the houses in his lord's domain just because his name is the same as the counter for houses. It isn't really fair, he complains to you, as you try to sneak by and lock him out of your house.
Ru_Russian:
свисающий край крыши, стреха́
счётный суффикс для зданий
Ru_Notes: Сравни: 庇 [ひさし] навес, козырёк — может быть и самостоятельным, а не только край крыши.
Ru_trainchinese: xuān: (графема) высокий; павильон, галерея с видом
Kanshudo_mnemonic: there's a dry (干) car (車) by the building
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: My house is very compact and efficient. The car is parked under the veranda, and a clothesline hangs above it.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " car " to the sound of " dry ", the original meaning is an ancient car with a tall front roof and a curtain for doctors and above to ride. "Shuowen": "Qu Yu Fan Cha. From the car, dry sound." "Zuo Zhuan‧ Aigong Fifteen Years": "The eldest son said: "Gou brought me into the country, served Mian Chengxuan, three Death has nothing to do."" Du Yinan: "Xuan, doctor's car."

" Xuan " can refer to cars in general. "The Eleventh Year of Zuo Zhuan‧ Aigong": "Or lewd in an out-of-state, people from out-of-state seize the Xuan to offer it." Du's note: "Xuan, the car."

" Xuan " also means carriage. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty-Yufu Zhishang": "The predecessors are Jiuyiyunhan, Fenghuangweiji, Pi Xuanluan Qi, all doctors." Liu Zhao quoted Hu Guang and said: "Pi Xuan, take tiger skin as the Xuan ."

" Xuan " also said that the front of the car is high and the back is low. "Poetry‧Xiaoya‧June": "The security of the military vehicle is as safe as a turret." Zheng Xuanjian: "The security of the military vehicle is as sincere as viewed from the back, viewed from the front as a porch, and then adjusted."

" Xuan " also means raising, raising, and opening. Han Wang Yanshou "Lu Lingguang Temple Fu": "Ben the tiger to grab and lean against the beam, and feast forever."

" Xuan " also means flying, flying appearance. "Selected Works‧Wang Can's "Poems for Cai Zidu"": "The hidden scales are in the abyss, and go to Yan Zaixuan." Li Shan's note: "Xuan, flying appearance."

" Xuan " also means to value, improve, and elevate. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty-Ma Yuan Biography": "A husband cannot make people in front of him, and he cannot make people in his post. Complaining against others cannot be annoying, and a minister is ashamed." Li Xian's note: "Speaking is nothing important. "

" Xuan " also refers to floor slabs and barriers. "Songs of the Chu: Recalling the Soul": "Gao Tang Yu, the threshold level Xuan." Wang Yi's note: "Xuan, the floor board." One said it was a cornice.

" Xuan " also refers to windows. The nineteenth of "Yong Huai" by Ruan Ji of the Three Kingdoms: "Opening the Xuan and facing the four wilds, climbing high and looking forward to thinking."

The provincial name of Xuanyuan is also called " Xuan ". "Selected Works‧Yan Yanzhi"Song Wen Emperor Yuan Empress Ai Ce Wen": "Kun is Shuncheng, Xing Xuan is embellished." Li Shan's note: "The Book of Han Dynasty" said: Xuanyuan, Huanglong body, former big star, heroine Xiangye ."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " car " to the sound of " dry ", the original meaning is an ancient car with a tall front roof and a curtain for doctors and above.
humanum_full_description:
從「車」，「干」聲，本義為古代一種前頂較高而有帷幕的車子，供大夫以上乘坐。《說文》：「曲輈藩車。从車，干聲。」《左傳‧哀公十五年》：「大子與之言曰：『苟使我入獲國，服冕乘軒，三死無與。』」杜預注：「軒，大夫車。」

　　「軒」可泛指車子。《左傳‧哀公十一年》：「或淫于外州，外州人奪之軒以獻。」杜預注：「軒，車也。」

　　「軒」也表示車廂。《後漢書‧輿服志上》：「前驅有九斿雲罕，鳳皇闟戟，皮軒鸞旗，皆大夫載。」劉昭注引胡廣曰：「皮軒，以虎皮為軒。」

　　「軒」還表示車子前高後低貌。《詩‧小雅‧六月》：「戎車既安，如輊如軒。」鄭玄箋：「戎車之安，從後視之如摯，從前視之如軒，然後適調也。」

　　「軒」也表示上舉、揚起、開張。漢王延壽〈魯靈光殿賦〉：「奔虎攫挐以梁倚，仡奮舋而軒鬐。」

　　「軒」亦表示飛翔、飛舉貌。《文選‧王粲〈贈蔡子篤詩〉》：「潛鱗在淵，歸鴈載軒。」李善注：「軒，飛貌。」

　　「軒」也指看重、提高、抬高。《後漢書‧馬援傳》：「夫居前不能令人輊，居後不能令人軒，與人怨不能為人患，臣所恥也。」李賢注：「言為人無所輕重也。」

　　「軒」還指樓板、欄檻。《楚辭‧招魂》：「高堂邃宇，檻層軒些。」王逸注：「軒，樓版也。」一說為飛檐。

　　「軒」也指窗戶。三國魏阮籍〈詠懷〉之十九：「開軒臨四野，登高望所思。」

　　軒轅的省稱也稱「軒」。《文選‧顏延之〈宋文皇帝元皇后哀策文〉》：「坤則順成，星軒潤飾。」李善注：「《漢書》曰：軒轅，黃龍體，前大星，女主象也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「車」，「干」聲，本義為古代一種前頂較高而有帷幕的車子，供大夫以上乘坐。

轩轩 		carriage, high, wide, balcony, flats, eaves

(Simplified: 轩)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 干 indicates the sound; 車 (cart) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 車 [ chē ] cart, vehicle; to move in a cart
    • 干 [ gàn ] arid, dry; to oppose; to offend; to invade
①古代一種有圍棚或帷幕的車：軒駕(帝王的車駕)。軒冕(卿大夫的車和禮服是分等級的，藉以指官爵祿位)。軒輊(車前高後低稱“軒”，車前低後高稱“輊”，用來喻高低優劣)。
②有窗的長廊或小屋。
③門、窗、樓板或欄杆。
④高：軒敞。軒昂。軒然大波。
⑤(軒轅)ａ．傳說中的上古帝王黃帝的名號；b．車轅；c．古代星名之一；d．複姓。
⑥姓氏。

軒轅 [ xuān yuán ]: Xuan Yuan, personal name of Huangdi, the Yellow Emperor 黄帝
軒轅 [ xuān yuán ]: two-character surname Xuanyuan
軒昂 [ xuān áng ]: high; lofty; elevated; dignified

Chinese: Flats in the city are crowded. You get a space for your car in front, and a clothesline out back.  You're very lucky if you have a veranda.

Meaning: veranda

軒並み(のきなみ): row of houses
軒(のき): eaves, house

從「 車 」，「 干 」聲，本義為古代一種前頂較高而有帷幕的車子，供大夫以上乘坐。《說文》：「曲輈藩車。从車，干聲。」《左傳‧哀公十五年》：「大子與之言曰：『苟使我入獲國，服冕乘軒，三死無與。』」杜預注：「軒，大夫車。」 「 軒 」可泛指車子。《左傳‧哀公十一年》：「或淫于外州，外州人奪之軒以獻。」杜預注：「軒，車也。」 「 軒 」也表示車廂。《後漢書‧輿服志上》：「前驅有九斿雲罕，鳳皇闟戟，皮軒鸞旗，皆大夫載。」劉昭注引胡廣曰：「皮軒，以虎皮為軒。」 「 軒 」還表示車子前高後低貌。《詩‧小雅‧六月》：「戎車既安，如輊如軒。」鄭玄箋：「戎車之安，從後視之如摯，從前視之如軒，然後適調也。」 「 軒 」也表示上舉、揚起、開張。漢王延壽〈魯靈光殿賦〉：「奔虎攫挐以梁倚，仡奮舋而軒鬐。」 「 軒 」亦表示飛翔、飛舉貌。《文選‧王粲〈贈蔡子篤詩〉》：「潛鱗在淵，歸鴈載軒。」李善注：「軒，飛貌。」 「 軒 」也指看重、提高、抬高。《後漢書‧馬援傳》：「夫居前不能令人輊，居後不能令人軒，與人怨不能為人患，臣所恥也。」李賢注：「言為人無所輕重也。」 「 軒 」還指樓板、欄檻。《楚辭‧招魂》：「高堂邃宇，檻層軒些。」王逸注：「軒，樓版也。」一說為飛檐。 「 軒 」也指窗戶。三國魏阮籍〈詠懷〉之十九：「開軒臨四野，登高望所思。」 軒轅的省稱也稱「 軒 」。《文選‧顏延之〈宋文皇帝元皇后哀策文〉》：「坤則順成，星軒潤飾。」李善注：「《漢書》曰：軒轅，黃龍體，前大星，女主象也。」
From the " car" to the sound of " dry", the original meaning is an ancient car with a tall front roof and a curtain for doctors and above to ride. "Shuowen": "Qu Yu Fan Cha. From the car, dry sound." "Zuo Zhuan‧ Aigong Fifteen Years": "The eldest son said: "Gou brought me into the country, served Mian Chengxuan, three Death has nothing to do."" Du Yinan: "Xuan, doctor's car." " Xuan" can refer to cars in general. "The Eleventh Year of Zuo Zhuan‧ Aigong": "Or lewd in an out-of-state, people from out-of-state seize the Xuan to offer it." Du's note: "Xuan, the car." " Xuan" also means carriage. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty-Yufu Zhishang": "The predecessors are Jiuyiyunhan, Fenghuangweiji, Pi Xuanluan Qi, all doctors." Liu Zhao quoted Hu Guang and said: "Pi Xuan, take tiger skin as the Xuan ." " Xuan" also said that the front of the car is high and the back is low. "Poetry‧Xiaoya‧June": "The security of the military vehicle is as safe as a turret." Zheng Xuanjian: "The security of the military vehicle is as sincere as viewed from the back, viewed from the front as a porch, and then adjusted." " Xuan" also means raising, raising, and opening. Han Wang Yanshou "Lu Lingguang Temple Fu": "Ben the tiger to grab and lean against the beam, and feast forever." " Xuan" also means flying, flying appearance. "Selected Works‧Wang Can's "Poems for Cai Zidu"": "The hidden scales are in the abyss, and go to Yan Zaixuan." Li Shan's note: "Xuan, flying appearance." " Xuan" also means to value, improve, and elevate. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty-Ma Yuan Biography": "A husband cannot make people in front of him, and he cannot make people in his post. Complaining against others cannot be annoying, and a minister is ashamed." Li Xian's note: "Speaking is nothing important. " " Xuan" also refers to floor slabs and barriers. "Songs of the Chu: Recalling the Soul": "Gao Tang Yu, the threshold level Xuan." Wang Yi's note: "Xuan, the floor board." One said it was a cornice. " Xuan" also refers to windows. The nineteenth of "Yong Huai" by Ruan Ji of the Three Kingdoms: "Opening the Xuan and facing the four wilds, climbing high and looking forward to thinking." The provincial name of Xuanyuan is also called " Xuan". "Selected Works‧Yan Yanzhi"Song Wen Emperor Yuan Empress Ai Ce Wen": "Kun is Shuncheng, Xing Xuan is embellished." Li Shan's note: "The Book of Han Dynasty" said: Xuanyuan, Huanglong body, former big star, heroine Xiangye ."

軒字的基本解释

軒
xuān
见“轩”。

軒字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xuān］
［《廣韻》虚言切，平元，曉。］
“轩1”的繁体字。“昕2”的被通假字。
(1)古代一种前顶较高而有帷幕的车子，供大夫以上乘坐。
(2)泛指车子。
(3)车厢。
(4)车子前高后低貌。
(5)上举，扬起；开张。
(6)飞翔；飞举貌。
(7)指舞貌。
(8)看重；提高；抬高。
(9)乘车。
(10)楼板，栏槛。《楚辞·招魂》：“高堂邃宇，檻層軒些。”王逸注：“軒，樓版也。”一说为飞檐。洪兴祖补注：“一云檐宇之末曰軒。”
(11)有窗户的长廊。
(12)窗户。
(13)屋檐。
(14)堂前屋檐下的平台。
(15)房室。
(16)以敞朗为特点的建筑物，如亭、阁、棚之类。
(17)指厕所。
(18)轩辕的省称。传说中的古代帝王名。
(19)轩辕的省称。古星名。
(20)宽悦貌。
(21)用同“揎”。推，撵。
(22)姓。
[②]［xiàn］
［《集韻》許建切，去願，曉。］
“轩2”的繁体字。
大的肉片。

軒字的康熙字典解释

【酉集下】【車字部】　軒； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页1240第03
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】?虛言切，音掀。【說文】曲輈轓車也。【徐曰】載物則直輈。軒，大夫以上車。轓，兩旁壁也。【左傳·閔二年】鶴有乘軒者。【註】軒，大夫車。【又】歸夫人魚軒。【註】魚軒，夫人車。又【定九年】與之犀軒。【註】犀軒，卿車。夫人車以魚爲飾，卿車以犀皮爲飾也。　又車前高曰軒，前下曰輊。【詩·小雅】戎車旣安，如輊如軒。【註】輊，車覆而前也。軒，車却而後也。【後漢·馬援傳】居前不能令人輊，居後不能令人軒。【註】言爲人無所輕重也。　又檐宇之末曰軒。【左思·魏都賦】周軒中天。【註】周軒，長廊有窗而周迴者。　又殿堂前檐特起曲椽無中梁者亦曰軒。天子不御正座而御平臺，曰臨軒。【前漢·史丹傳】天子自臨軒檻。【註】軒檻，欄版也。　又軒縣，樂縣也。【周禮·春官·小胥】諸侯軒縣。【註】軒縣三面，其形曲，故又謂之曲縣。　又笑貌。【後漢·方技傳】軒渠笑自若。【天祿外史】韓王軒然仰笑。　又舞貌。【淮南子·道應訓】軒軒然迎風而舞。　又自得之貌。【唐書·孔戣傳】軒軒自

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xuān］
["Guangyun" False Words, Ping Yuan, Xiao. ]
Traditional characters for "轩1". "Xin 2" was passed falsely.
(1) An ancient car with a tall front roof and a curtain for doctors and above.
(2) Refers to cars in general.
(3) Carriage.
(4) The front of the car is high and the back is low.
(5) Lift, raise; open.
(6) Flying; flying appearance.
(7) Refers to the dance appearance.
(8) Value; Improve; Elevate.
(9) Take a car.
(10) Floor slabs and barriers. "Songs of the Chu: Recalling the Soul": "Gaotangxuanyu, the threshold level Xuan." Wang Yi's note: "Xuan, the floor board." One said it was a cornice. Hong Xingzu's supplementary note: "The end of a cloud eaves is called Xuan."
(11) A long corridor with windows.
(12) Windows.
(13) Eaves.
(14) The platform under the eaves in front of the hall.
(15) Atrium.
(16) Buildings characterized by openness, such as pavilions, pavilions, and sheds.
(17) Refers to the toilet.
(18) The provincial name of Xuanyuan. The legendary name of the ancient emperor.
(19) The provincial name of Xuanyuan. Ancient star name.
(20) Wide and pleasant appearance.
(21) Use the same as "揎". Push, push.
(22) Last name.
[②]［xiàn］
["Ji Yun" Xu Jianqie, go to wish, Xiao. ]

Large slices of meat.

[You Ji 2] [Car Character Department] 　 Xuan; Kangxi Strokes: 10; Page Number: Page 1240 No. 03
[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting]? Make false words and sound off. [Said the text] Qu Lei Che also. [Xu Yue] The load is straight. Xuan, the doctor got on the bus. Ke, on both sides of the wall. [Zuo Zhuan·Min Ernian] He has a Chengxuan person. [Note] Xuan, doctor's car. [Also] Mrs. Yuxuan. [Note] Yuxuan, Mrs. Car. Also【Ding Nine Years】Yixixuan. [Note] Xixuan, Qing car. The lady car is decorated with fish, and the Qing car is decorated with rhino skin.　The front of the car is high and it is called Xuan, and the front is down and it is called Shi. 【Poetry·Xiaoya】The Rong Che is in peace, as if it were like a penthouse. [Note] Shi, the car is over. Xuan, the car is behind. [Later Han·Ma Yuan Biography] Being in the front can't make people awkward, and being behind can't make people awkward. 【Note】Speaking has nothing to do with people.　The end of the eaves is called Xuan. 【Zuo Si·Wei Du Fu】Zhou Xuan Zhongtian. [Note] Zhou Xuan, there are windows in the corridor and Zhou Hui.　The eaves in front of the hall are also called Xuan if the rafters have no middle beams. The emperor does not impose a seat, but a platform, called Linxuan. [Previous Han·Shi Dan Biography] The emperor came from the threshold of Xuanxuan. [Note] Xuan threshold, column version also.　Youxuan County, Le County also. 【Zhou Li·Chun Guan·Xiaoxu】Zhuhouxuan County. [Note] Xuan County has three sides, its shape and song, so it is also called Qu County.　 Smile again. [Later Han·Fang Ji Biography] Xuanqu smiled freely. [Tianlu Outer History] Han Wang Xuanran smiled.　Dancing appearance again. [Huainanzi·Tao Yingxun] Xuan Xuanran dances in the wind.　Self-satisfied appearance. Name meaning
Nothing.
xuān
вм. 轩
Radicals: 車, 干  (car, dry)
Meaning Mnemonic
Your car is dry because you kept it under the eaves of your house.
This kanji has a second meaning too: house counter. Imagine counting all the houses on your block by the number of eaves you see keeping cars dry.
One eave, one house. Two eaves, two houses.
Reading Mnemonic
On top of the eaves of your house Ken (けん) the samurai is counting houses too.
Ken hops down and explains that he's been hired to count all the houses in his lord's domain just because his name is the same as the counter for houses. It isn't really fair, he complains to you, as you try to sneak by and lock him out of your house.
